Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Pastor Martin Chang, Edge City Church, located at 46-16 Little Neck Parkway, Queens, N.Y. 11362.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Lee.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Martin Chang, Edge City Church, located at 46-16 Little Neck Parkway, Queens, N.Y. 11362.

Council Member Lee moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: A Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.5322-B/S.4246-B, also known as the Packaging Reduction and Recycling Infrastructure Act, which would establish an extended producer responsibility system for packaging.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice-vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 8 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote negative on this item:

Council Members Ariola, Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Paladino, Vernikov, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Borelli)

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Packaging Reduction and Recycling Infrastructure Act (A.5322-B/S.4246-B).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation declaring April 26 annually as Korean War Veterans and Korean Defense Veterans Recognition Day to celebrate the bravery and sacrifice of those who served
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Veterans
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Declaring April 26 annually as Korean War Veterans and Korean Defense Veterans Recognition Day to celebrate the bravery and sacrifice of those who served.

Items.MatterName: End Hedge Fund Control of American Homes Act.

Items.MatterName: Creating a business directory for NYCHA tenant-owned businesses and establishing a marketing campaign to highlight the New York city housing authority tenant-owned business directory.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Social Worker Workforce Act (A.5291/S.5975).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the visibility of the ride timer in pedicabs
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Visibility of the ride timer in pedicabs.

Items.MatterName: Establish a tax incentive program to encourage developers to plant new trees in development sites.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Farías) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías).

There were 50 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, May 16, 2024.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Application number N 220434 ZRM (15-21 West 124th Street) submitted by Harlem, LLC, pursuant to Section 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York, modifying parking provisions of Article IX, Chapter 7 (Special 125th Street District), Borough of Manhattan, Community Districts 10 and 11, Council District 9.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Zoning and Franchises
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 15-21 West 124th Street, Manhattan (N 220434 ZRM)

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

L.U. No. 57 & Res. No. 392,  VOTE: 35-15-0
Negative: Council Members Aviles, Brewer, Cabán, Gutierrez, Hanif, Holden, Krishnan, Marmorato, Marte, Mealy, Nurse, Paladino, Sanchez, Vernikov, and Yeger.

Preconsidered L.U. No. 72 & Res. No. 379,  VOTE: 46-3-1
Negative: Council Members Abreu, Brewer, Mealy;
Abstentions: Council Member Stevens.

See files for individual votes.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.Title: Motion by Council Member Williams to recommit LU 63 and Res 396 back to Land Use.
Items.ActionName: A Motion was made and Approved by Council
Items.ActionText: This Motion was A Motion was made and Approved by Council
